UAObject.Description: Folder containing all data used for Energy Flexibility
This folder aggregates all flexible loads associated with the energy flexible machine. Use this folder for energy flexiblity automation

UAVariable.Description: Average power in conjuction with the "Unit" node. Use this node if the loads power can not be measured directly or indirectly. See technical documentation of the load
In CO2-eq/h
Node that represents the current state of the load, either on or off.
The type of the load, e.g. electric, pneumatic, thermal, etc.
The unit either associated with the "AveragePower" or "Power" node
Average power in conjuction with the "Unit" node. Use this node if the loads power can not be measured directly or indirectly. See technical documentation of the load

UAObject.Description: This folder aggregates all load changes. Iterate over children for automation.
Folder containing all data used for Energy Management

UAVariable.Description: Describes how the baseline value was calculated.

Value.uax:String: Calculated with daily average CEF_total. Measured on Jan 19th 2024.

UAVariable.Description: Baseline for the KPI, defined by a standard-process.
Length of the interval used for calculating the baseline and all subsequent values of the KPI. Unit: hours
Current value of the KPI, changes until completion of the current interval
Begin of the current interval used for KPI calculation
Improvement from baseline, can be can be above or below 1
How the KPI is defined, including units, e.g. Workpieces/Wh
Describes how the baseline value was calculated.

Value.uax:String: Calculated with daily average electicity price, using current day-ahead data.

UAVariable.Description: Baseline for the KPI, defined by a standard-process.
Length of the interval used for calculating the baseline and all subsequent values of the KPI. Unit: hours
Current value of the KPI, changes until completion of the current interval
Begin of the current interval used for KPI calculation
Improvement from baseline, can be can be above or below 1
How the KPI is defined, including units, e.g. Workpieces/Wh

UAObject.Description: This folder aggregates all loads within a machine, independent of flexibility. Use this folder for monitoring.

Marks the beginning of the interval up to now, in which the other variables contained in the RunTimeDataType are calculated
Integer value of workpieces completed in the given timeframe.
working hours/length of the timeframe used to calculate completed jobs and workpieces
Total CO2 Emission of the machine in a given timeframe, from "BeginOfCalculation to now. In conjunction with a unit.
Marks the datetime, from which to now the amount of emitted CO2 is calculated.
Current CO2 Emission in unit/time, preferrably CO2-eq/h.
The unit of the co2 Emitted, e.g. CO2-eq.
Total energy amount used, calculated from "BeginOfCalculation" to now.
Datetime, marks the beginning of the calculation for the total energy used.
Current Consumption in unit/time.
Type of energy, e.g. electric, thermal, pressurized air, etc.
Unit of the consumed energy, e.g. Watt, Joule, Liters(bar).
Total energy amount used, calculated from "BeginOfCalculation" to now.
Datetime, marks the beginning of the calculation for the total energy used.
Current Consumption in unit/time.
Type of energy, e.g. electric, thermal, pressurized air, etc.
Unit of the consumed energy, e.g. Watt, Joule, Liters(bar).
A human-readable, localized name of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem.
A globally unique resource identifier provided by the manufacturer of the machine

A string containing a unique production number of the manufacturer of the MachineryItem. The global uniqueness of the serial number is only given in the context of the manufacturer, and potentially the model. The value shall not change during the life-cycle of the MachineryItem.
